user.title: Solar Window System Setup
user.description: Choose the type of configuration you want to set up.

global_init.title: Solar Window System
global_init.description: Set up the basic parameters for the Solar Window System. All settings can be changed later.

data_description.min_solar_radiation: Minimum radiation (in W/m²) for the calculation to be active.
data_description.min_sun_elevation: Minimum sun elevation (in degrees) for the calculation to be active.
data_description.weather_warning_sensor: A binary sensor that indicates a weather warning (e.g., storm). If 'on', the blinds will close.
data_description.forecast_temperature_sensor: A sensor that provides the temperature forecast for the day. Used for advanced scenarios.

global_thresholds.title: Default Thresholds and Physical Properties
global_thresholds.description: Configure the default thresholds for solar radiation and the physical properties of the windows. These values are used when they are not set on a window or group.

global_scenarios.title: Default Scenario Parameters
global_scenarios.description: Configure the default parameters for the shading scenarios. These values are used when they are not set on a window or group.

window_init.title: Add a new Window
window_init.description: Set up the basic parameters for your new window. The values for tilt, g-value and frame-width are taken from the global configuration, but can be overwritten here.

window_overrides.title: Window Specific Overrides
window_overrides.description: Here you can define specific overrides for the global values. If a value is not set, the global default is used.

add_group.title: Add a new Group
add_group.description: Set up a new group for your windows.

abort.already_configured: An entry for the Solar Window System has already been configured. You can manage the settings under Integrations.
